name: Arien
lore: When Arien's war galley was ambushed and destroyed by an unknown vessel, he blamed himself for the loss of the crew. He now offers his blade and his knowledge of the arcane to anyone who can help him find his nemesis.
advice:
- Your silver card is probably the most powerful tool in your arsenal. It can force your opponents to play around it, as long as you are close enough to the action.
- Use your gold card to protect friendly units and to set up future attacks.
- Both of your green branches are great for mobility and setting uo attacks, as long as you can play around their limitations.

name: Brogan
lore: Brogan regained his sense in the midst of battle. War drums resonated with the pounding in his ears, and the elf made a note to quit Drakenhuff Grof. As the enemy mounted their charge, he reached behind him: first feeling the strings of his lute, then the handle of his axe.
advice:
- If you expect trouble, play your silver card.
- Use fast travel and attacks with built-in movement to compensate for your low mobility.
- Don't let yourself get stranded away from the action.
- An attack card in hand can be as much of a threat as an attack card played.
- Do not underestimate your support options.

name: Tigerclaw
lore: Tigerclaw is as elusive as a shadow in the desert. A useful quality to have, when half the continent wants you dead and the other half wants you quartered first and then dead.
advice:
- The best defense is not to get hit at all.
- Use mobility and your silver card to stay alive.
- Ranged attacks and discard effects are the main threats to you.  
- Enemies can deny you your basic attacks by blocking a crucial space. Do not let them!

name: Wasp
lore: As all heiresses to the throne of the Gilded Empire, Wasp was exiled from the palace as soon as she could hold a dagger. She needs to learn to control her powers before she can face the ultimate challenge and claim her birthright.
advice:
- Your gold card carries the most value when you are close to the enemy heroes. However, you do not have the capacity to endure consistent damage. Know when to disengage.
- Your silver card is a versatile tool that can be used to deny enemies access to minions.
- You have access to many tools that can disrupt enemy positioning, and deny attacks when used in the right moment.

name: Sabina
lore: One lesson that Sabina learned when serving as a condottiere, was that any weapon could misfire, and any armor could crack, but true comradery would never fail. When an old friend called in a favor, she didn't hesitate.
advice:
- You become considerably stronger when you are near friendly minions. Stay in formation!
- Your gold card is a great defensive counter to non-ranged attacks.
- Your main weakness is your below-average defense, paired with a lack of self-heal.
- Position in a way to be able to use your silver.
- Your choice of red branch will strongly impact your avenues to victory. Choose wisely.

name: Xargatha
lore: Xargatha was the high priestess of the sacred shrine when it was desecrated and the holy relic was stolen. Her anger and grief were so powerful that they transformed her into a monster. She abandoned the temple to find the thieves and return the relic.
advice:
- Offense is the best defense. Use your gold card to dissuade the enemy from attacking.
- Your silver card is extremely versatile. It can be used to farm minions more easily, assist allies, and set up ambushes.
- You can use high movement on your primary red card to pursue wounded enemy heroes and finish them off with your gold card.

name: Dodger
lore: Dodger hated delving through the dusty tomes. It was always the more practical aspect of dark magic that fascinated her, so when a daemon offered to complete her training by bypassing the boring formalities, it took a mirror for her to realize that there was fine print in that contract.
advice:
- Your main weakness is your low defense. Keep this in mind when leveling up.
- You are stronger when there are many empty minion spawn points in the battle zone, which can be achieved by defeating minions or displacing them through other means.
- Some cards let you remove friendly minions. Use this to control when the lane is pushed.

name: Rowenna
lore: From a young age, Rowenna dreamed of becoming a knight. She trained relentlessly, honing her combat skills and mastering the code of chivalry. Whether facing monstrous beasts or overwhelming odds, Rowenna stands unwavering, ready to defend the innocent, support her comrades, and lead her troops to victory.
advice:
- Your silver is most effective when jumping to a space adjacent to multiple enemy units.
- Your best chance to defeat an enemy hero with your gold card is when they have a low-defense card in their discard.
- Talk to your teammates to maximize the impact of your red cards.

name: Garrus
lore: Garrus was the reigning champion of the Arena until his defeat at the hands of a stranger, who tricked him into losing his temper. He roams the land, seeking to regain his title and his honor. They say that his shield can deflect a point-blank ballista shot. No one has ever dared to check if it's true.
advice:
- Attacking second with your gold card can be an easy way to deal extra damage.
- Your silver card can be very effective against heroes with high movement values.
- With certain builds, enemies may be forced to prioritize you as a target when you have a card in the discard. Use this to your advantage.

name: Bain
lore: I wouldn't go around asking questions about Bain. Shady character, that one. Some say he is a nobleman looking for his lost sister, some say he is just an ordinary drunk. Drunk or not, he is the best shot this side of the desert. Unless you want him for a job, stay clear of him, partner!
advice:
- The psychological effect of the bounty marker should not be underestimated.
- Your silver card can save allies, disrupt enemies, and help clear minion waves faster.

name: Whisper
lore: Whisper was the Grand Judicator of the Underkingdom when he condemned a powerful noble attempting to escape punishment. Refusing to look the other way, he was blinded and left to die. As if he wasn't dead in the first place! The fools!
advice:
- Your primary weakness is your limited mobility, with the exception of your green cards.
- Your gold card can assist your allies in hunting down enemy heroes or scaring them away.
- However, time your gold carefully; if used at the wrong moment, the target might escape.
- Your silver makes you difficult to kill, provided there is a wounded enemy nearby.

name: Misa
lore: Misa will fight against overwhelming odds to protect her master. Unfortunately, she has yet to find anyone worthy of her blade and loyalty.
advice:
- Mise is one of the quirkiest heroes in the game. Most of your cards do not follow the usual conventions.
- You only have one attack card. Make it count.
- Your gold card is both your best defense and best movement, but it cannot defeat minions.
- Your role is closely tied to your choice of green card. One branch helps with pushing the lane, while the other is more fight-oriented.
- When used in the right moment, your silver card can both deny minion and protect allies.

name: Ursafar
lore: When Ursafar roars, the frost beasts cower in their icy caves, and the tribesmen place fresh fish outside their igloos to appease the great bear.
advice:
- You excel when enemies come to you; don't waste precious movement on pursuits.
- Often, the best way to fuel your rage is by attacking a minion with your red or gold cards. Use your blues as a backup source of rage.
- Your biggest weakness is low base mobility, and your worst nightmare is finding yourself on the wrong side of the board after a lane push.
- Once enraged, you can use your gold, followed by your silver, as powerful zoning tools.

name: Silverarrow
lore: Silverarrow never imagined she would leave the Forest until the Oracle uttered the prophecy. The hardest step of any path is the very first one; after that, you just keep moving.
advice:
- Your ranged attacks are among the most powerful, but they are fairly easy to disrupt. Know your weaknesses and don't let the enemies surprise you.
- Being adjacent to enemy units disables a large portion of your abilities. Keep your distance!
- While it may feel tempting to stay away from the fight, don't leave your allies alone. They rely on your firepower and utility skills.

name: Min
lore: The monks of the Order of the Dragon once worshipped the ancient beasts. But with their patrons gone, Min and his brothers had to adopt more practical applications of their beliefs
advice:
- End movement in straight lines from enemy heroes to utilize your smoke bomb.
- Your gold card can be powered up even if your red card was used for movement or defense.
- Mines cover more ground but are less reliable. Grenades require precise timing.

name: Mrak
lore: In the shadows beneath the old cobblestone bridge, where whispers of forgotten tales and echoes of passing travelers intertwine, resides Mrak. As befits a retired troll geomancer, he isn’t particularly fond of unexpected guests.
advice:
- Mrak specializes in area denial and control.
- You are difficult to take down, especially if you level up the alternative red branch.
- If you struggle with low mobility, the alternative green branch will get you rolling.

name: Cutter
lore: The daring exploits of Cutter, the captain of the skyship Black Sparrow, are the crowd favorite in every tavern across the continent! She traded her life as a noble-born debutante for that of a swashbuckler and a scoundrel.
advice:
- Both your gold and red cards can be tricky to land, so use your other tools to set them up.
- Your silver allows you to move long distances at low initiative, enabling aggressive plays.
- Primary blue and green rely on timing but can force tough choices on your opponents.
- Your alternate green branch offers reliable mobility and helps set up minion takes.
- Your alt blue can get you extra coin, if you have an action to spare.

name: Trinkets
lore: Trinkets is really smart — well, by kobold standards, that is. He was expelled from Drakenhuff after almost destroying the entire city. When he’s not busy constructing doomsday devices or unearthing spare parts, he’s tinkering with his automated turret.
advice:
- Plan ahead when placing your turret to avoid spending actions on moving it each round.
- Use the turret to tactically block key spaces.
- Your level-up choices significantly influence your strategic options, so choose wisely.

name: Tali
lore: When she heard their voices for the first time, no one believed her. Tali held no grudges. When the frost beasts threatened her tribe, she did what she had to do. And when the village was saved, she left — the spirits were calling her.
advice:
- Tali relies on her team to do the right thing. Make sure that you are all on the same page.
- Know when you can afford to discard a card.
- Your basic attack benefits from attack items more than most.

name: Swift
lore: When Swift’s application to the Royal Fleet Academy was declined, she didn’t give up on her dreams of roaming the skies. She joined the mobile scouts just before the Last War and earned her place as the best shot of her regiment.
advice:
- Threatening to attack both an enemy hero and a minion forces the hero to react.
- The sniper rifle is more effective for pushing, while the shotgun excels against heroes.
- Sometimes, it’s better to use your gold card to defeat an adjacent minion.
- If you’re having difficulty landing attacks, rely on your blue and green Tactician skills.

name: Wuk
lore: The grove does not need protection; Wuk simply chooses to stay here. Trees make the best company when you prefer not to be disturbed. If you’re daring enough to enter his domain, whatever you do, don’t touch the trees!
advice:
- Plan ahead. Where will you need those trees next turn? And what about in the next round?
- You can use trees to block key spaces.
- Mobility is not your strongest attribute, so move along when the wave is about to push.

name: Hanu
lore: A day without mischief is a day wasted. Free from his brother’s wise guidance, Hanu roams the ruins of the old Atlantean capital, playing tricks on any would-be explorer reckless enough to enter the domain of the Great Tricker.
advice:
- Your gold card will help you stay alive as long as you have an escape route.
- Your silver can assist your allies in landing attacks, but it can also be used on enemy heroes to force them to move early when they intended to go later.
- It’s often worth strategizing with your team, even if it reveals your plans. You have many ways to set up your allies for success.

name: Brynn
lore: Born in a remote mountain settlement, Brunn was expected to become a healer like her mother. However, her true passion lay in braving the surrounding wilderness. When a mysterious plague struck and even her mother fell ill, Bryn set out for the fabled grove where the only cure could be found.
advice:
- When the condition isn’t met, your cards still have an effect. The non-conditional part is less powerful but much more reliable.
- Coordinate with your team — they can help you unlock the full potential of your cards.
- Your red ranged attack makes you a better pusher but also leaves you more vulnerable.
- Use the silver to help your team get minions.

name: Mortimer
lore: Mortimer the Awakener wields an ancient relic from a bygone age, forged from obsidian and infused with the pure essence of Death Metal. As he plucks the strings of his isntrument, the fallen souls of his fans rise!
advice:
- Use your zombies to zone and block enemy heroes, but be cautious not to obstruct friendly heroes' movement.
- You are considerably stronger at higher levels and your farm blue can get you there faster.

name: Widget & Pyro
lore: Widget’s tribe clung to the old ways — quite unusual for kobolds. The young warrior paid little attention to fairy tales or the dusty prophecies about the dragons’ return, until one journey led her to a strange egg. When it hatched, she named the youngling Pyro.
advice:
- Pyro is Widget’s dragon companion, who you can summon using her silver card.
- While Pyro is on the board, Widget becomes significantly more powerful.
- Although Pyro is represented by a miniature, he counts as a token and can be removed by a “Clear” action — keep him out of trouble.
- Winning with this duo comes from properly positioning Pyro and timing your gold attack.

name: Snorri
lore: Like any other self-respecting dwarf, Snorri never planned to go on an adventure. That plan went south when his former apprentice strayed from the path of tradition and delved into the murky realm of experimental runic graffiti. Snorri needed to adjust his plans.
advice:
- Plan ahead. Readjusting rune placement costs you an action.
- The higher your level, the more versatile you become. Ensure you get enough coins.

name: Razzle
lore: A lesser-known fact about magical mirrors is that they break easily. Razzle froze as her mirror shattered into a myriad of twinkling fragments, as if a troupe of mischievous pixies had decided to test their acrobatic skills. When the silence fell, she found herself surrounded by a host of identical faces, each wearing an expression of utter confusion.
advice:
- At the start of the game or when you respawn, there's only one of you placed on the board.
- Once a copy is spawned, you cannot spawn it again with your gold card.
- The more of you in play, the stronger you are.
- Your survival often relies on keeping your clones within the radius of your silver card.

name: Gydion
lore: Gydion the Archwizard is an odd blend of ancient wisdom and forgetfulness that could make a goldfish look like a meticulous archivist. Despite this, he has an uncanny knack for invoking the right spells at exactly the right moment.
advice:
- When casting spells, treat the actions on spell cards like any other actions.
- Keep spells you cannot cast yet in a separate facedown pile while they remain in the spellbook.

name: NebKher
lore: NebKher is an enigmatic traveler, draped in exotic garb, his face concealed behind a terrifying mask. Those who have encountered him speak of his unnatural powers over the minds of living beings.
advice:
- Keep as many opponents within range of your gold as possible to maximize your options.
- Your silver allows you to rearrange resolved cards of other heroes, which is useful for your gold.
- Your green cards, paired with your silver, are your main mobility tool. Play them early.

name: Ignatia
lore: There is a fine line between genius and madness, and Ignatia is the living proof of this. The dwarven fire-mage is as powerful as she is unpredictable, just like the forces she commands.
advice:
- Always aim to have a target, regardless of which side the tie-breaker coin lands on.
- The effects tied to your team's color are less likely to be thwarted by an untimely coin flip.
- Your silver card allows you to take full control of your powers, but it makes you significantly more vulnerable while in use.

name: Takahide
lore: Takahide rose to become a feared warlord, leading his armies from victory to victory — until a lone warrior refused to obey his orders. Now, he is consumed by a relentless obsession to crush his warrior for defying him.
advice:
- You have access to three gold cards, instead of one, though only one of them is in your hand (until you reach the ultimate).
- Plan ahead, and try to have the exact gold card that you need in your hand at the exact time when you need it.
- A lot of your skills require allies to have discarded cards. Talk to your allies and make sure you work together as a team.

name: Emmitt
lore: Emmitt the Traveler is a visitor from the distant future. Armed with a portable time-travel device, he fights to restore fractured timelines, using both his sharp mind and the occasional power-fist punch, appearing where and when he is needed most.
advice:
- The effect of your gold card impacts everyone, so be cautious not to endanger your allies.
- Use your silver to boost mobility, but remember it makes you more vulnerable.
